node.title: Facebook group 'seeing laugh reacts on death' as COVID misinformation spreads
node.description: COVID-19 has intensified misinformation and community polarisation along issues like vaccination, but it's a symptom of a broader problem facing social media.
node.content:
["It's a realm that has been described by Prime Minister Scott Morrison as a \"coward's place\".", "And, according to It US\u00a0whistleblower Frances Haugen, it has the power to\u00a0\"harm children, stoke division and weaken our democracy.\"", "Yet misinformation on Facebook and other social-media platforms continues and there is\u00a0no easy fix.", "Politicians have blamed Facebook's\u00a0failure to rein in anonymous trolls,\u00a0as calls for greater government regulation\u00a0grow.", "Yet between the tech giant\u00a0and\u00a0government, there\u00a0are other key players in the prevention of misinformation\u00a0\u2014 the everyday users.", "
For those 'on the fence'
", "Jenna Schr\u00f6der\u00a0manages a community Facebook group usually reserved for posts about missing pets, business recommendations and sunset photos.", "", "
Jenna Schr\u00f6der is the admin of the Labrador 4215 community group on Facebook.(Supplied: Jenna\u00a0Schr\u00f6der)
", "The group, which\u00a0has about 4,300 members,\u00a0is used by residents in the Gold Coast suburb of Labrador to share local information.", "But in a lengthy post published this week, Ms Schr\u00f6der\u00a0outlined her policy to remove COVID-conspiracies and anti-vaccine comments.", "\"You are not a scientist.\"", "Ms Schr\u00f6der\u00a0said she would not\u00a0change the minds of conspiracy theorists.", "But she said those managing such community groups\u00a0had\u00a0a responsibility to weed out false information.", "\"The more you argue against them, the more you strengthen their belief,\" she said.", "\"It's important to give them the best chance of reading correct information.\"", "
Misinformation versus disinformation
", "Misinformation and disinformation often fall\u00a0under the umbrella term of 'fake news' \u2014 a topic studied in depth by La Trobe University's Associate Professor Andrea Carson in the Department of Politics, Media and Philosophy.", "", "
Andrea Carson says tech companies, government and users must address misinformation.(Supplied: La Trobe University)
", "\"Trust in family and friends online over the 18 months of the pandemic has actually gone up, whereas\u00a0trust in politicians and journalists has gone down,\" she said.", "\"Citizens need to recognise that if they don't know the veracity or the truthfulness of the information, don't share it.\"", "Misinformation can be spread without the explicit intent to deceive or harm others\u00a0and can include satirical articles or even clickbait.", "\"[But] that's problematic because we do know that since COVID, misinformation can cause harm and we've seen that with some of the false advice over COVID treatments,\" Associate Professor Carson said.", "", "
Facebook has adopted a voluntary code of conduct in Australia.(Reuters: Dado Ruvic)
", "Disinformation, however, is the intentional spread of misleading information in pursuit of a deliberate goal.", "\"But there is a degree of overlap because we can't always divine what someone's intention is,\" she said.", "It's a complicated issue that taps into freedom of speech and censorship, but also\u00a0challenges those just trying to form a community connection.", "
How to regulate or prevent?
", "In February, tech giants like Facebook and Google adopted a voluntary code of conduct aimed at stemming the spread of mis/disinformation.", "The code gives each platform discretion over what measures to implement,\u00a0ranging from the prioritisation of official and credible sources, to labelling or removing false information or accounts.", "\"It'll be reviewed by the media authority and the government at the start of next year and then we'll get a picture about how satisfactory these measures have been,\" Associate Professor Carson said.", "She said the role of government was\u00a0the \"seminal question\" but that \"we don't\u00a0want commercial businesses being the arbiters of what should be taken down\".", "\"We need to have a degree of government regulation around this at arm's length.\"", "Associate Professor Carson said finding the balance had\u00a0proven problematic in \"electoral autocracies\" like Indonesia and Singapore, whose laws have been criticised for potentially\u00a0suppressing media freedom and silencing political opposition.", "\"Many of these countries have rushed to enact these laws under the cover of COVID,\" she said.", "\u201cIt's a way to strengthen government power.\"", "
'Laugh reacts on death'
", "Ms\u00a0Schr\u00f6der, who is studying a Masters of Digital Communication, said \"a lot of people do solely get news off social media, they have distrust in the news\".", "She only posts information about COVID from official sources like Queensland Health.", "\"I'm keeping it pretty limited, so really not posting much about COVID, but if I'm sharing contact tracing, I\u2019ll turn off comments straight away,\" she said.", "\"I don't want to deal with the conspiracies that get posted.\"", "But more broadly, Ms Schr\u00f6der\u00a0says\u00a0she's worried about how the tone of conversation on Facebook\u00a0has been changing.", "\"Initially it was concern and being afraid \u2014 now it is anger and people trying to irritate people,\" she said.", "\"Seeing laugh reacts on death and things like that, just blows my mind.\""]
